This document combines multiple formatting types in realistic scenarios.

Project Overview

The goal is to create a sync tool that handles:
  1. Apple Notes export via Swift bridge
  2. Markdown conversion for Supernote
  3. Bidirectional sync with conflict resolution

Note: This is currently in development. See https://github.com/example/repo for updates.

Key Features

  • Real-time sync with --watch flag
  • Support for nested folders and special characters
  • Automatic conflict resolution (Apple wins)

Code Example

def sync_notes(direction: str = "forward"):
    """
    Sync notes between Apple Notes and Supernote.
    """
    if direction == "bidirectional":
        run_reverse_sync()
        run_forward_sync()

Technical Details

The architecture uses:
  1. Swift Bridge
    • ScriptingBridge API access
    • JSON export format
    • Handles all note types
  2. Python Orchestrator
    • Click-based CLI
    • SQLite state tracking
    • Multiple generators

Visit our docs for the full API reference.

Conclusion

This mixed content tests bold, italic, code, links like https://example.com, and various block elements together.
